This package "normalize" string look by replace all homoglyphs with base characters (AŒë–ê·é™·óÖ·¥ÄÍìÆ -> AAAAAAA).
That's useful to detect similar strings. For example, if you wish to prohibit "duplicates" with confusing nicknames and so on.

I added a library for authorization and related article of how to integrate this library with Express based API.
The library is called CASL - https://github.com/stalniy/casl. There are also a lot of interesting stuff in  documentation - https://stalniy.github.io/casl/ and related articles on Medium.
The library has been around for few months, I used it on several projects and believe it's a very good addition to this list.
Thanks for your time guys!
Relates to #752

Reason to add

Faster than any other pure JS implementation
don't loose any information in reverse transformation. (xml -> js -> xml)
can be used in NPM package, browser, or CLI

I'm the CTO and Co-Founder of datree.io and AWS Community Hero. This is a hands-on Webinar with live coding that I'm presenting about how to build a CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions, Node.js and AWS ECS Fargate. We have hundreds of RSVPs and I genuinely think that it's valuable to this community.
https://dtr.ee/2DURIVu
Let me know what you think!
Best regards,
Shimon Tolts

Trace API calls and Monitor API performance, health and usage statistics.
With statistics and metrics exposed by swagger-stats you may spot problematic API endpoints, see where most of errors happens, catch long-running requests, analyze details of last errors, observe trends, setup alerting.

Document Versioning: Support users on all versions of your project. Document versioning helps you keep documentation in sync with project releases

GitHub: https://github.com/opticdev/optic
Website: https://www.useoptic.com
Optic automatically documents changes, tests every endpoint, and gives you valuable insight into how your APIs are being used.
Features:
üìù Accurate API Documentation - We built Optic to make maintaining accurate specs for your APIs automatic and developer friendly. Once you add Optic to your API repo, it automatically tracks your API‚Äôs behavior and maintains a change log of its behavior over time.
It‚Äôs kind of like Git, but instead of tracking files, Optic automatically diffs and tracks API endpoints. When new behavior is observed, Optic makes it easy to update the spec.
‚öôÔ∏è Automated Testing - Automate most of your contract testing. Optic uses live testing with spec coverage to make testing APIs easy.
üëç Beautiful Docs - Stripe-style documentation for every API managed by Optic.
üëã 100% Open Source, Runs locally, data is only stored in your API Repo

üëã I decided to update the description of my OAuth client, that I initially added to this list in 2015 #230
A lot have changed since then, and so I though that it might be useful to outline the key selling points as of today, because that might be useful information for anyone searching for such solution.
Main difference is that Grant now ships with 4 serverless handlers, making it a viable solution for Lambda Functions, and then I also added a handler for Fastify.
